caption.title: Models explaining the observed responses.
caption.p:
Each column shows results for one of the four models with the highest level of agreement between expected and observed responses. In the upper row, the current range of Pinus sylvestris (thin grey line) and its future climate suitability are shown (grey-yellow-green scale; 0 < HS < 1000). In the lower row, the expected variation of climate suitability is shown (grey-yellow-green scale), together with the observed responses of Pinus sylvestris populations: green points represent populations with positive responses, grey points represent neutral responses, and red points represent negative responses. The small histograms within lower maps show the results of the null-model tests of agreement between expected and observed responses: when the vertical red line is on the left of the black line, P{A
